metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6369 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: Insufficient checks in the UDF subsystem in Firebird 2.5.x before 2.5.7 and 3.0.x before 3.0.2 allow remote authenticated users to execute code by using a 'system' entrypoint from fbudf.so. It was discovered that Firebird exposed certain UDF libraries. An authenticated attacker could use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: firebird3.0 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.2.32703.ds4-11ubuntu2').
